tr.td: Failed to load latest commit information.

a.title:
Element.transform().toString() fix attempt
Sometimes calling .transform().toString() returns an object, instead of a string.
elproto._.transform gets assigned to the toString() property of the transform() return value, but this value is an object.
Sample case: http://jsfiddle.net/bitblitter/hUWT7/3/
Fixed bug in mouse handler and update tests

span.a: Fixed bug in mouse handler and update tests

a.title:
Decouple all the things and bug fixes
â¢ extract matrix, attar & paper.js â¢ fix for transform for sag element â¢ add Fragment to plugin call

span.a: Decouple all the things and bug fixes

a.title:
Prefixed values
Added ability to specify attributes as `"+=10"` or `"-=1em"` or `"*=2"` Bug #243.
Issue with triggering .animate() from another .animate()'s callback
Moved docs from dist/ to doc/

span.a: Moved docs from dist/ to doc/

a.title: Fix for prepend of set. Keeping order intact.

span.a: Fix for prepend of set. Keeping order intact.

a.title:
Fixing npm install by updating main property
main is the property npm uses to know what to require. It was requiring the Gruntfile instead of the compiled source. :beers:

span.a: Fixing npm install by updating main property

a.title: Fixed tests. Added new tests for class methods. Fix for bug #227

span.a: Fixed tests. Added new tests for class methods. Fix for bug

div.class: boxed-group flush clearfix announce instapaper_body md

article.p: A JavaScript SVG library for the modern web. Learn more at snapsvg.io.
In your HTML file, load simply by: <script src="snap.svg-min.js"></script> No other scripts are needed. Both the minified and uncompressed (for development) versions are in the /dist folder.

li.p: Open the terminal from the Snap.svg directory:
Install its command line interface (CLI) globally:

p.em: *You might need to use sudo npm, depending on your configuration.
*Snap.svg uses Grunt 0.4.0. You might want to read more on their website if you havenât upgraded since a lot has changed.

ul.li: Type grunt in the command line to build the files.
The results will be built into the release folder.
Alternatively type grunt watch to have the build run automatically when you make changes to source files.

li.p: Make a pull request to dev branch.

article.p: Note: Pull requests to other branches than dev or without filled CLA wouldnât be accepted.

body.div: Something went wrong with that request. Please try again.
